Aerial view of a fog-engulfed forest in Kvarken Archipelago

Logos of past collaborators and partners: Roskilde Festival 2022, Confucius Institute IBA Kolding, Antiyber Bullying Project, OLDstars, Slovo 21, Franklin Covey Czech, Divadlo na Vinohradech, Brick Gallery and Barae.
Photo of skerries covered by vegetation, located in the Archipelago sea
Photo of several boulder archipelagos with erected wind turbines, located in the Archipelago sea
Photo of Andreas standing on the rock in the forest with a hiking pole out of a tree branch
Marcel and Andreas are captured walking along the road, hitchhiking with their left thumbs, trying to stop approaching the car.
Outside view at our Djupviksgrottan cave camp, Marcel is reading a book and Andreas is keeping an eye on a campfire.
Photo of pilgrims Marcel and Andreas walking over dusty red path up on a hill with Autumn forests in their background.
Photo of an old blue Ford tractor with big red wheels, standing on aside of the road. The scene is listed by the morning sun.
Photo of Andreas and Marcel hiking through the forest in the northern part of Alands.
Shot of a garden and family house built in a typical Scandinavian style - pastel green facade made out of wooden planks with white outlined corners and windows.
Photo of an empty road through the Autumn colored forest, aside from the road stands a traffic sign informing about the name of our surroundings - Prästo.

Photo of two really old Jewish gravestones on the former cemetery in the middle of Forrest, covered by moss and containing text in Hebrew. There are tiny stacks of small boulders on the top of each gravestone, as a symbol of respect and remembrance.
Photo of me carrying posing Marcel upon my shoulders while standing in the cold Archipelago sea.
Photo of resting Andreas with dark sky in the background. Andreas’s face is highlighted by the screen of the phone he is holding
Photo of a giant World War Two bunker, covered by graffiti and being lifted from its base on the sandy beach. The North Sea and another bunker can be seen in the background.s
Photo of dunes covered by heath, in the left top corner can be seen a family house built among the dunes that are as high as the house.
WWII bunker sinking into the sand beach with metal decorations of horsetail and neck, kids are playing around.
View upon a wide hilly heath with Blåvand lighthouse in the background.
Panorama photo of landscape view from the top of Blåvand lighthouse. Both on right and left can be seen North sea and beaches, in between are mostly dunes covered by rusty heath.
Shot of abandoned property with garden and old family house built in a typical Scandinavian style - pastel green facade made out of wooden planks with white outlined corners and windows.
Shot of abandoned property with garden and old family house built in a typical Scandinavian style - pastel green facade made out of wooden planks with white outlined corners and windows.
Photo of an empty room in the abandoned building, lit by the morning sun.
Photo taken from a plan view of an old wooden narrow staircase. The staircase leads from the ground floor to the first floor.
